Dear Harry:
First of all, let me hasten to acknowledge the receipt of your
note of July 11th, together with the copy of the letter from Wallenborn of
the European Broadcasting Union. I find that he was kind enough to send
me a copy of his original note to you. I want to congratulate you on putting
this through. I think NAEB's membership in the European Broadcasting
Union, even if only on an associate basis, will add materially to our
prestige abroad and at the same time provide a source of valuable materials.
I realize that we'll still have to worry about additional payments, but I think
we ought to be able to cross that bridge when we come to it.
L
,
In view of the fact that Schooley may be away on vacation, I am
sending to you herewith the draft of the Agenda for the General Assembly of
the Prix Italia in Rimini beginning September 11th. If you have any suggestions
or ideas which might be of particular interest to us for any added items, please
let me know at your early convenience so that this can be added and taken up by
the Assembly.
I expect to get a note off to you very shortly concerning the entries
which we are sending to Rimini for this year's Prix Italia. At the moment
there is still some uncertainty about my going personally because there appears
to be a lack of travel funds. If this situation cannot be corrected, I think we may
have Bernie Buck represent us on the General Assembly as well as on the Jury.
I will keep you informed.
